means: 使发呆，使昏昏沉沉( stupefy的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Primrose, stupefied by tiredness, began to wail that she was hungry.
sentence.Network_cn: 普丽姆罗丝累得精神都有些恍惚了，开始哭着说她饿了。

sentence.Network_en: He was stupefied by the amount they had spent.
sentence.Network_cn: 得知他们花了那么多钱，他都惊呆了。

entry.tran: 使震惊;使惊呆;使惊愕;使神志不清
entry.def: If something stupefies you, it shocks or surprises you so much that you cannot think properly for a while.

example.ex: ...a violent slap on the side of the head, which stunned and stupefied him.
example.tran: 他的一边脑袋上猛地挨了一掌，使他顿时觉得晕头转向，昏天黑地

means.word_mean: 1. as if struck dumb with astonishment and surprise;

sentences.sentence: "a circle of policement stood dumbfounded by her denial of having seen the accident"
"was thunderstruck by the news of his promotion"

means.word_mean: 2. in a state of mental numbness especially as resulting from shock;

sentences.sentence: "he had a dazed expression on his face"
"lay semiconscious, stunned (or stupefied) by the blow"

auth_sentence.content: Anxiety stupefied instead of quickening his senses.
auth_sentence.res_content: Anxiety stupefied instead of quickening his senses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Anxiety stupefied instead of quickening his senses.

auth_sentence.content: Lao Lan, stupefied by his predicament, ran straight toward Father and me.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lao Lan, stupefied by his predicament, ran straight toward Father and me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lao Lan, stupefied by his predicament, ran straight toward Father and me.

auth_sentence.content: I remember being stupefied, many years ago, when, ignorant of van Meegeren, I came upon the painting in the Boijmans.
